website_summaries.verdict: The XYZprinting Da Vinci Jr. 3D Printer's low cost and high ease of use make it an ideal entry-level 3D printer for anyone.
pros: The XYZprinting Da Vinci Jr. 3D Printer is easy to set up and use, requires no calibration and is currently the most inexpensive 3D printer on the market
cons: The printer is relatively bulky considering its small build platform
It uses XYZprinting proprietary consumables and glue may be needed for it to offer a high success rate

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic first 3D printer.
customer_reviews.text: I've been researching 3D printers for some time now and this one seemed to be the best one to start with. I was not disappointed when I received my Da Vinci Jr 1.0w printer. Almost as soon as I un-boxed it, I had it printing. I definitely would recommend this to anyone who knows nothing about 3D printing, but wants to get into the 3D printing world. I would have given this 5 stars, but the fact that you are locked into using XYZprinting's filament is what held me back. Every other aspect of this printer is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Aumuller

customer_reviews.title: You can only use XYZ filaments
customer_reviews.text: We are having a great time with this printer! My daughters school got one of these when she was in third grade last year. Her teacher found that she was so good with it, she recommended that we should get one for her at home. I was pleasantly surprised by the price. The computer program is pretty easy and there are a bunch of places to find downloadable files. My only complaint is that you are forced to only buy their filaments in their chipped cartridges. They are double and triple the price of generic filaments. That is really unfortunate. We will probably upgrade to one that doesn't require that in the next year.
customer_reviews.author: B. Klotzek

customer_reviews.title: The Good: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Great Printer! Works like magic. I would highly recommend this to any family that wants to get started with 3D Printing. No Calibration making this easy for anyone. The Bad: You have to use the company filament the price is not too bad but at least you know you are using compatible PLA. The machine only prints in PLA. Sometimes the print does not stick. All i did was used a glue stick and it worked like magic. Another issue is that sometimes the print bed will rip. To fix this I went to Target and got yellow painters tape. In the end this is a great machine and would highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not worth money. Customer service from xyz is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Have for 2 years. Customer service is terrible. Parts you cannot order. Took 3 months just for customer service to find the part and list it to sell. Dont do this. Dont buy. You will be stuck paying twice as much for half the filament. Not worth the money. It works but small print bed. If you get this YouTube how to bypass the required spool chip
customer_reviews.author: MAINE REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: It's been very easy for him to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas present for our 12 year old. He loves it. It's been very easy for him to use. The software interface is good and offers lots of templates to use for printing and downloading files. There are some times when the tape moves or nozzles get plugged that extra maintenance is required. My kid is good at solving those problems on his own, but it might be good to have a semi-mechanical adult around because the tape moves and lines get plugged occasionally This product could be used by adults and children alike; anyone that's a beginner level in 3D printing..
customer_reviews.author: JJS

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a good entry-level printer
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good entry-level printer. I had a little difficulty setting it up and setting the z-axis, but once I got through that it printed well. I have had some trouble with it here and there not feeding into the extruder properly, and one of the small pieces that the tube fits into had to be replaced. Their customer service is great, though. They walked me through different steps to diagnose and fix my problems, as well as sent a replacement part. It's not perfect, but it's good for the price and I am happy with it. It's a good thing to learn and practice with and maybe one day I will get a higher-end model.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing youth/beginner product!!! Worth every penny!! Honestly wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was great right out of the box. 20 minutes to unpack, set up, hook up, and start our first print! Product directions not as good as they could be, but manageable. 11 printed items from the first role and still have 25% left. Tens of thousands of free models to download and print from dozens of sites. We had difficulty with two different prints due to the initial filament layer not sticking to the base and had to clean the head unit. Great introductory product!!! For the price you could not ask for anything else!! Easy for even a child to use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level printer
customer_reviews.text: Good entry level printer. If you want to print small objects and do not care about the fine detail then this is the printer for you. Cons: Proprietary filament. Software is not as robust as competition. Pros: Few issues, consistent print quality. Fully enclosed. With some serious modification you can make this a great printer. Out of the box this printer is great with the XYZ provided filament but after several months of use I find myself limited by this design and proprietary components such as the NFC filament. I have since purchased a printer that supports multiple filament types.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: 0 pro which works great
customer_reviews.text: Had hard time due to the fact you can't level the bed Many failed prints. Sent it back and got the davinci 1.0 pro which works great
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my pre teen son who has a bit of 3d printing experience. Took a bit more time getting it to talk to our iMac and had better luck using 3rd party mapping software. Once up and running, worked okay. Multiple glitches, extractor issues,etc after less than a year. Several attempts at tech support, but ZERO responses. Only beginner printer (at the time) in this price range, but all of the issues and lack of support soured our experience. You get what you pay for.....
customer_reviews.author: chris miller

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful tech support
customer_reviews.text: This is our first 3d printer and I couldn't figure out how to get the filament to come out of the nozzle. I had followed the instructions on loading. The printer was trying to print, but nothing was coming out. I called support, spoke to Alejandra who was very nice. She knew instantly what I was doing wrong. She explained that you need to cut the filament at a 45 degree angle so that it can feed better into the extruder. Now we are in business! This prints nicely. My son is happy. I would definitely recommend this printer, and this company. Alejandra, you were most helpful. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to use and has a great print quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had my printer for several months now and have been really impressed. It's easy to use and has a great print quality. The only thing keeping me from a 5 star review is that you do have to do a little playing with the z-offset. it advertises no need to adjust but i found that the default settings was close enough to the print bed that it wouldn't let the filament extrude as quickly as the motor will push it. it causes a fairly loud thunking noise. I have a hard time really complaining about that though, with how quick it is to fix the offset.
customer_reviews.author: Ross H.

customer_reviews.title: product is shipped with good boxes and styrofoam
customer_reviews.text: Unboxing and setup only took a day and a half... product is shipped with good boxes and styrofoam, the website xyz and the manual help with installation... comes with filament and spool . Xyzware may be primitive but it’s a great beginners toolset for 3D printing.. worth the amount paid.. only thing that’s a downside is that it doesn’t have a good polygon editor nor does it print obj files.. needs a converting tool or a native file format printing
customer_reviews.author: J. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Runs around the clock and is still printing awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty excited about this printer. It is my first printer. So far I have printed an F1 rc car, iPhone stand, hot wheels track pieces, key chains, sprinkler parts, parts for my SCX10 rc car, and a lot more. I had to make an adjustment to the bed and Z height (for those who don't know what that is, neither did I before I owned one, it's not complicated, just complicated words haha) I am tempted to buy a second so I can double my production!
customer_reviews.author: teewuane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and affordable 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: Since this is probably the cheapest printer around I wasn't expecting a lot from it, the reviews on amazon also weren't that good, but I still bought it. I've been printing a lot of stuff on it, it does has a learning curve but also any other 3D printer around, the quality of this printer is amazing and it doesn't feel cheap at all. The video tutorials on XYZprinting website are very helpful. Thanks XYZprinting for making 3D printing easy and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Hiram Farrera

customer_reviews.title: Consider an Upgradrd Version
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one as a piece popped out and it stopped working. Extreme fun until it stopped working. Got the replacement and it stopped working within one week. Returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Fenway1222

customer_reviews.title: Intro level printer with caveats
customer_reviews.text: This is most certainly an "entry level" device. The print quality is marginally okay. I am also convinced the company spent twice as much time engineering the "copy protection" on their proprietary filament as they did on the rest of the printer. The printer will at times spew out ribbons of media in a snarl of black hair; or otherwise just botch up a good print job 80% into it. Argh. But with that being said, it does a good basic job. If you can't afford more, than this is what you (and I!) get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Printer is great, refills not so good.
customer_reviews.text: The printer is a great printer. The filament color selection is limited. You must use their printer refills that have an electronic circuit in them preventing use of other brands. The availability is also limited and the price seems volatile. I bought a black refill for $28 and the next week the price increased to $38.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M Driskell

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer. I bought it back in 2015 and have been using it ever since. It does what I need it to without issue. I personally use it to print small formicariums for my ant keeping hobby. Lots of other small home items from thingiverse. Its a great introduction printer and will keep and hobbyist 3d printer happy.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Entry-Level Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is one of the best entry level printer's I've come across! Whether you're an expect in the 3D printing industry, or completely new to it, XYZPrinting makes it ridiculously easy to get stellar-looking/quality prints--no fuss whatsoever! The only drawback I could note (aside from the somewhat limited, but still suitable print volume) is the propietary filament--HOWEVER, this elimnates all issues conerning fidgeting with temperatures, speeds, etc.. I will most likely return to XYZPrinting for all my future 3D printing needs!
customer_reviews.author: DoubleDTVx2

customer_reviews.title: So, so very bad.
customer_reviews.text: Five months later and we still can't get the thing to print properly. The software is junk. Spent days searching the net for tutorials and help. Good lord, really? This is basically a fancy box full of false hope.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Does anyone know where to get the bed paper coming ...
customer_reviews.text: Does anyone know where to get the bed paper coming with the 3D printer? I have tried many methods (PET sheet, bed tapes, etc) but the components just couldn't stick to the bed and the printing failed. I found the bed paper coming with the machine is the most reliable. I have search the amazon but it seems that it is not for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up - fully assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Fully assembled and easy to set up - working with it and having some success, but as a newbie there are problems. Sometimes it just "skips" and doesn't even get started, and sometime it gets half way through and then "gives up." After I've worked with it for a while, I'm going to call support if I still have problems. 3M blue painter tape works great, The price was unbelievable, so already it's been a really good deal - just for experience.
customer_reviews.author: MikiB

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really simple to use i had a little panic attack at the beginning since this was the first 3D printer i got, but I got it up and running in ten minutes and successfully printed 5 things so far Only two complaints: 1. The power cord is a little to short for my liking but that is a small problem has been easily worked around 2. The raft and supports don't come off as easily has I would've hoped, but once again it has been easily worked around
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for a year and a half and so far it has been great! I have used it for many projects over hours and hours of printing. Here is what I have learned from it: Pros - No mechanical issues - Average print times - Good quality prints - Easy navigation of controls - User-friendly - Decent maximum print size Cons - Expensive filament must be bought from XYZprinting - Software allows for minimal customization of print settings - Some prints are difficult to remove from the print bed - Some prints that have items that fit together do not fit
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: My first 3d printer and I am a happy camper!
customer_reviews.text: Outschtanding buy for under 300 dollars. Got the delivery unpacked and with in an hour I had my first 3d print. Have done several prints since then and it is working like a machine should...perfectly. The print quality is reasonable and the print time is acceptable...maybe a bit longer than I would like, but being retired it has it's rewards. There is a bit of foot work to be done for the 3d design software,but it is all free ware on the internet. Recommend strongly for beginners and people that want to get a start in to the 3d world and are not quite sure where to start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this printer is great and perfect for my class
customer_reviews.text: So far this printer is great and perfect for my class. My only complaint is that some of the set up is not clear enough in the directions and the software it comes with is confusing. I have my students using tinkercad then exporting their project to the software to print.
customer_reviews.author: jonescal

customer_reviews.title: Only for the mechanically gifted. Not easy to use. Fails pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not easy to use. I understand that 3D printers require a lot of tuning. But that isn't made clear in the product description. In this century easy to use is a pretty high standard. I actually had to replace this right after I bought it because the first one only printed the test print and nothing else. The second one worked for a while then ultimately failed after about a month. 3D printer manufacturers should be more explicit about how much work it takes maintaining and adjusting their products.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Results
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Jr. 3d Da Vinci printer for my son birthday. Well packaged and very nice. Minor issues is getting the printer to print from the samples in the software and the only sample is a heart which would come off the table. 5 days trying to reach the tech support and on the fit day, David a teach support was very helpful. I am pleased with how he guide me through my issues and how helpful he was. I am pleased and soon will be getting the pro 3 in 1 for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Luis A De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Scanner is low quality and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for the. Scanner only and I was disappointed. It has a beginners scanner.
customer_reviews.author: GKJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended, EXCELLENT support!
customer_reviews.text: This printer does a really nice job, particularly for the price. I had been watching the technology develop for the past few years and finally decided to go with this one. The support I've received from XYZPrinting is also excellent. I was having a few flow issues with the extruder module and the tech support guy, Hosman, spent over an hour with me on a Skype call talking me through the solution. Hosman was very patient and very professional. The printer is now back in full operation. Nice to know that XYZPrinting supports their product so well; makes it worth more than the sticker price by a long way. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my dad. He was playing around with it for weeks having trouble figuring it out and making it work. Best gift my family has got him in years.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: We have been very happy with this fun and functional printer! Bought this to learn with my 8 year old son who is now 9 - he loves making little things to give to his friends. Relatively easy interface. It takes a bit of futzing with to keep everything flowing smoothly, but I have found the support and informational materials to be helpful when needed. Overall very happy with this purchase and I would buy from XYZ again.
customer_reviews.author: david herald

customer_reviews.title: ... never using a 3D printer before and couldn't be happier. There isn't much of a learning curve with ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer never using a 3D printer before and couldn't be happier. There isn't much of a learning curve with the included easy to use software. Great for any beginner. I couldn't ask for much more. XYZ is always updating the included software and firmware on the printer, tweaking and including new features. People who have asked me how I made the models I share with them what I have and recommend it for them or their kids to learn on. This printer would be GREAT if you have a child looking to try 3D printing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good printer especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My printer worked well out of the box. I did use the tape on the plate multiple times with out issues. Items with a small base did not stick well. Not much filament available. My printer has a damaged extruder cable out of box. Instructions were terrible.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: the directions are not easy to follow and they don't give you a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Problems with the nozzle. The material that is used to print kept clogging up in the nozzle. This was only the second time we used it. Also had problems with the wifi. Kept losing the source. Lastly, the directions are not easy to follow and they don't give you a lot of guidance.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Lowe

customer_reviews.title: a good entry level 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: I give this printer 4 stars for what it is, a good entry level 3D printer. I found it easy to use and only had a couple of failed prints and one was do to my use of model not designed to be printed. I would recomened using a glue stick to coat the build plate and use brims for best results. I've used it to print out phone stands for friends as well as parts to fix or use for things around the house including replacements for my aquarium air stones. The drawback is the filament is limited to PLA from the company, but it's a reasonable tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: When printing it does a decent job,
customer_reviews.text: When printing it does a decent job, my biggest complaint is you're restricted to using their filament instead of being able to use other brands
customer_reviews.author: Charles U.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty on the outside, but...
customer_reviews.text: Used to like it, then I realized you have to pay 20 to 30 dollars per filament reel, also if you want a new printer nozzle be ready to drop 100 dollars, and you can only use their filament! Would not recommend this to starters.
customer_reviews.author: Gianni F.

customer_reviews.title: Great little units
customer_reviews.text: Great little units. I bought several for young students. Had to replace one and customer service was fast and professional. These are a great trainer unit. Well worth the price. Its a price point so don't expect $50k quality but fairly descent and great for teaching/learning the concept.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The first main thing is that the filament has to be a special type purchased through XYZ, as it has a lock on other filament. The printer was good for the first several prints with high resolution. However, prints began to fail, as the bed tape barely lasted through a few prints. Now, my extruder is completely clogged all around with melted filament. Thus when I am printing, the calibration is all knocked off and random filament is being placed everywhere. I now have a 3D printer that will barely print and I missed the return period by just a few days. I really wish I could return the product and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Teke

customer_reviews.title: and for the most part its been great. I'm still having issues designing my own stuff
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 6 months now, and for the most part its been great. I'm still having issues designing my own stuff, but that has nothing to with the printer. The only issues I've had with the printer itself was a couple parts gots worn out, but I was able to replace them and ended up with some spare parts in the process for less $20. I might one day upgrade to something more fancy, kind of eyballing the true color XYZ printer, but for now this thing works great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron A.

customer_reviews.title: Working great right out box.
customer_reviews.text: Working great right out of a box. My first 3D printer and I did not think it was too bad to set up.
customer_reviews.author: 5crazymonkeys

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great starter 3D printer and contains all needed to print... good value. Only caveat is that you will have to buy their branded filaments, but reasonable priced.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from the black PLA
customer_reviews.text: Do like the ease of set up. The two things I do not like are it is next to impossible to use outside source PLA and the printer head stopped working properly after using the XYZ black PLA.
customer_reviews.author: alan Plant

customer_reviews.title: Filament Tube Teeth Are Very Flimsy, Wouldn’t Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My terminology may be incorrect, but the teeth that feed the filament through the filament tube break very easily and usually within the first 30 prints. I wouldn’t recommend this overall. It is easy to use and setup but you’re better off saving your money for a flashforge.
customer_reviews.author: Eyedea

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to learn - this is my first 3D printer and I've had it nearly a year now and still enjoy it just as much. I had one problem with it, which was easily fixed by emailing for troubleshooting advice and following the directions given. Until multi-color printers come down in price, I'm sticking with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Richelle R. Votaw

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: You can only use their proprietary filament that's twice the cost for half the quality and the NFC tag on the filament doesn't let you use the last 25% of the spool. They are literally making you throw away hundreds of feet of expensive filament still on the spool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level device
customer_reviews.text: Very good entry level printer. I had heard of some trouble with Z offset adjustment before I purchased and immediately checked mine when it came in. It came programmed with 1.7mm offset and after a couple tests found 1.6mm to be the optimal setting. Not bad for manufacturer calibration. Software is glitchy, but this is a really easy printer to use. I was producing quality prints on day one, and by day two felt confident to build any model out there. Here is an example of a model built with 3Dcreationist on my iPhone and it's real life counterpart. Not bad XYZ.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very solid prints. Print quality is good for the price. Wifi works pretty seamless too. Don't like that you have to use their own ink, but it does make it easy. No temp control, just uses the NFC to see what ink it is. Customer service good with issues as well (replacement parts, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: jrpj16

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with using XYZ Jr's expensive and faulty filament.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is getting may family inspired by the power of a 3d printer. I would like to be able to use better filament, this one only lets you use the XYZ Da Vinci Jr filament, some of it is expensive and not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: way fun to print things i want
customer_reviews.text: Its an awesome printer easy to use software great print quality and no problems that couldn't be solved with the guide that was given
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Parker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Surprised me with the simplicity of 3D printing.
customer_reviews.author: T. mauldin

customer_reviews.title: Really cool! I bought this as a present and he ...
customer_reviews.text: Really cool! I bought this as a present and he loves it. Would recommend. It’s really neat to watch. Easy enough to set up too.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Their customer service (I spoke with Hosman) is excellent when needing support
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these printers I have purchased. Their customer service (I spoke with Hosman) is excellent when needing support. After a serious catastrophe at my home, he was able to get my printer working again within 20 minutes. This is a great company and a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Skarr

customer_reviews.title: 3D printer is compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: 3D printer is compact and easy to use. However their method of accounting for filament used sucks! I have not been able to use several meters of filament because the chip registered the spool as unidentified. It appears that any time you unload the filament it does not increase the available balance on the spool so when you reload the filament again it further reduces the available balance causing an incorrect balance available on the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Only worked to make 3 very small items then it never worked again
customer_reviews.author: natasha beck

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Have to return twice; first arrived broken with tube detached and replacement used three times when it imploded. This item isn’t durable and my nephew is disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great intro printer
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this printer and has made some useful things for us to have around the house
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Price. But keep it Clean!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing beginners printer. So far no problems. My tip is to make sure you clean the nozzle and fans often! Or the prints won't work as well and come out "stringy"
customer_reviews.author: Robert Adamék

customer_reviews.title: Print quality isn't bad with small prints
customer_reviews.text: Less than a week owning this and feeder gear is clicking intermittently..Print quality isn't bad with small prints..Notice it prints better after cleaning extruder after every print, even tho manual claims to clean machine after every 25hrs.other than that , this is my first machine and I guess it's not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jg

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the price, needs adjusting
customer_reviews.text: A little finicky but once you get the timing down and the range it works fine. Takes some getting used to and if the needle is too far away or too close it ruins it. Suggest a lot of practice spools.
customer_reviews.author: T Gililand

customer_reviews.title: Overall a fairly simple and easy to use printer that returns consistent and quality results
customer_reviews.text: Overall a fairly simple and easy to use printer that returns consistent and quality results. The only problems I've had with it are that 1. you cant use 3rd part filament and 2. the slicer software isn't the best. Besides this, nearly all prints have been successful and usually produces very clean results.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: so it must be pretty hit and miss as far as quality is concerned
customer_reviews.text: I know that there are a lot of mixed reviews on this product, so it must be pretty hit and miss as far as quality is concerned. This machine printed perfectly right out of the box. I was worried that I would have to calibrate it at first, but I haven't had to yet. Great product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mills

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it except the instructions. Difficult to read and very limited.
customer_reviews.author: s kimmel

customer_reviews.title: very smart guy, and he loved this thing
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a budding engineer, very smart guy, and he loved this thing. He's already made a few little things with it and has talked about possible projects he could do.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: XYX 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this printer for quite awhile now. I have to say I am quite impressed by the eases of use. Everything worded great right out of box. No hassles. Printed my first item within one hour. This is a great starter 3d printed for getting started. The thing size is amazing for this printer. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money, awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer for the price. I haven't stopped printing since I got it. It took me longer to unpack it than it did to start printing. Great product for beginner 3D printers. . Easy to use, easy filament changing. This will be the best Christmas present ever.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L

customer_reviews.title: it's terrible. It is extremely inconsistent in its prints
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it's terrible. It is extremely inconsistent in its prints, and really does not have any intuitive software. I got about 3 successful prints from it, and even after sending in to XYZ, it bricked itself, rendering it completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Good starter, but.....
customer_reviews.text: Product works very well print quality is excellent, but the only thing I don't like is that you're confined to only buying XYZ specific filament which isn't that cheap and is smaller than a normal spool. You also can't print the biggest items and the printer isn't the quietest I have ever heard.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works adequately in Slow (0.1) mode; does not print reliably at faster speeds. Makes noise as it prints, seems to be worm gear 'knocking' because it can't feed filament. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: barmintrout

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Lots of fun. I am using to get get the grand kids interested inthetechnology.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Love my printer I use it to print toys for ...
customer_reviews.text: Love my printer I use it to print toys for my child Its made with great quality and parts. It doesnt take long to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Ward

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Was advertised as working with Mac, the main reason I bout it. It only works with 10.13 or earlier which means that your software has to be at least 3 years old to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for your Classroom
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this 3D printer from XYZprinting for my classroom. It was really easy to set up provided you followed the directions. I was printing within about 30 minutes. I have printed a model of the Great Wall of China, a Ziggurat, and the Roman Colosseum. This is a great printer for the money and works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in the classroom. Students love seeing their creations come to life.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: We got this for our daughter for Xmas. It ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our daughter for Xmas. It printed one item and then the extruder jammed. After a month of dealing with customer service, we finally go a replacement extruder. We installed the replacement extruder and it still doesn't work. Trying to get our money back or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Not what was advertised
customer_reviews.text: Box had holes with duct tape over them. Filament was old dried out and keeps breaking. The one I ordered was 3 in 1, only 1 left. 3d print, 3d scanner, and wireless. One I received is not wireless, does not have the 3d scanner. Customer service was a dead end.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Nobles

customer_reviews.title: Buy one of these
customer_reviews.text: It was a great buy at $349 but I got it on sale for $249. Incredible price for a fantastic entry level 3D printer.
customer_reviews.author: DeaconBlue57

customer_reviews.title: This was my first 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: This was the first 3d printer i have ever gotten. It was a great 3d printer with the many things i have 3d printed. But i dont like that were locked to xyz's filament. Tip if you dont have the masking tape just use a glue stick.
customer_reviews.author: MANDIE NICHOLAS

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRINTER!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME PRINTER!! It was 200 U.S. dollars and it is better than a $1000 Flash Forge Dreamer. My art teacher has a $1000 Flash Forge Dreamer and she said this one prints higher quality than her's. GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Surles

customer_reviews.title: So far this machine has worked great. My kids (16 yr) have created many prints
customer_reviews.text: So far this machine has worked great. My kids (16 yr) have created many prints. The only downside is the printing media but for this price range you cant beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Mc

customer_reviews.title: Good beginning 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: If you want to have filament left over this is your 3d printer had it for about a month and have so much filaments left over. Good for a beginner but will coast you a arm and a leg in the long term
customer_reviews.author: KrackTech Inc.

customer_reviews.title: very slow and not responding to the USB. connection.
customer_reviews.text: this printer was damaged in the first place. the software is not responding or works properly with the printer. I could not work it out either through the USB nether the wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Ibtihal S.

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, just needed to add glue to the tape on the base so it sticks better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sample print was fine, but I cannot get it to print out ...
customer_reviews.text: The sample print was fine, but I cannot get it to print out anything else. I receive a "printer mismatch" error and cannot figure out why or how to fix it. Also can't get through to XYZ's tech area for help and leaving a message doesn't work, they won't call back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little 3D printer!
customer_reviews.text: This little printer has been excellent! Get a glue stick and coat the platform right before each build and make sure that you clean the platform after each build as well. When following that procedure we have had nothing but success. Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Good first printer
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent first printer but I grew out of it withing 6 months. It quality is decent but you will find yourself filling and sanding a lot. Customer support it great and very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Chayna P.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING.
customer_reviews.text: WORKED FOR ABOUT 2 MONTHS THEN JUST QUIT AND WILL NOT TURN ON. CAN NOT GET SUPPORT FROM AMAZON OR XYZ PRINTING. DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING.
customer_reviews.author: VERNON R.

customer_reviews.title: For an entry level printer this is great. Already looking at upgrading and hacking this one ...
customer_reviews.text: For an entry level printer this is great. Already looking at upgrading and hacking this one to use different filaments
customer_reviews.author: McGarnagle

customer_reviews.title: Works fine when I use it for about 20+ times
customer_reviews.text: Works fine when I use it for about 20+ times. But it finally stopped working after 1 month. Customer service sucks. I am so said and angry, don't want to say more...
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this, wish it used universal filament
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest little Dynamo! Love this, wish it used universal filament.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but limited.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Would have given 5 stars, but DaVinci has essentially locked down the consumables on their products and disables the printer from using any filament supplies except their own.
customer_reviews.author: FCDI

customer_reviews.title: Just an easy way to put your kids and yourself on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just an easy way to put your kids and yourself on the way of 3D Printing revolution. Easy to install and use. Of course there is some tricks to learn within the first printing failures but that is the kind of experience I was looking for with my first 3 D printer.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Mantovani

customer_reviews.title: My 13 year old was printing within an hour
customer_reviews.text: It works well right out of the box. My 13 year old was printing within an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome. Love the printer
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome. Love the printer. Wish it had more design software with it but you can find some of that on-line. Printing wise - its awesome
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect prints every time!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! Since the first calibration it has printed perfectly every time. Proprietary filament is a small price to pay for no-hassle printing. Just need a few more filament color options. I stopped using the print bed tape and just use a glue stick, which wipes off the glass easily with a moist paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine!!!!! Worked right out of the box, I have more expensive printers but this one is my go to machine!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad For A Starter Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was good at the start. It worked well and printed well. The only downside was that later on once I used it more it started making a lot of misprints. If you want it go ahead but you may regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Cirincione

customer_reviews.title: Bought one of these a while Back.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these a while Back. It has served well. I had to replace the tube fitting once but other than that it has performed well. Hopefully someday they will remove the restriction of only using their filament.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Falendysz

product_meta.title: da Vinci Jr. 1.0 3D Printer ~ 6” x 6'' x 6'' Built Volume (Includes: $14 300g PLA Filament , $49 3D Design eBook, $10 Maintenance Tools, XYZmaker 3D Design CAD Software) – Fully Enclosed Design for PLA/ Tough PLA/ PETG/ Antibacterial PLA
product_meta.description: Color:OriginalDon’t let its slimmer and lighter look fool you, the da Vinci Jr. has a robust build size of 5.9 x 5.9 x 5.9 inches and a resolution of 100 to 400 microns. Its design allows for the inclusion of an auto-feeding filament system, which takes the PLA filament to the extruder, and ensures that the filament is loaded properly and is ready to print. The Jr. 1.0 only prints in DEHP-free and Heavy metal-free PLA filament.
feature_bullets: Free XYZmaker 3D design software, Free XYZware 3D printing software, Free XYZprinting STEAM 3D printing curriculum.
Easy Z-offset calibration, adjust your print bed with ease on the LCD screen. No time consuming 3 knob calibration needed.

The da Vinci Jr. series prints only with XYZprinting's bio-compostable, non-toxic PLA filament. The PLA filament derives from natural materials, such as sugarcane and corn starch, and has gone through various tests to ensure that it is DEHP-free and Heavy Metal-free.
Build size of 5.9" x 5.9" x 5.9" and Print Speed Upgrade: Max print speed up to 100mm/second. (XYZware software must be version V2.1.12.1 or above)

UL listed “for the purpose of classification or evaluation with respect to one or more of the following: (1) specific risks only, e.g., casualty, fire or shock, (2) performance under specified conditions, (3) regulatory codes, (4) other standards, including international standards, or (5) such other conditions as UL may consider desirable
